title: The ratio of A's and B 's is 4:5 the product of their ages is 320yrs then find the age of A and B? - Quora
tags: Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery Degrees

response.answer_text: Ratio of the ages of A and B=A:B=4:5 (1)Product of their ages =A.B=320 (2)From equation (1)A:B=4:5A/B=4/5A=4B/5 (3) Put the value of A from (3) in equation (2)A.B=320(4B/5)(B)=3204B^2/5=3204B^2=1600B^2=1600/4B^2=400Taking square root on both sides√B^2=√400B=±20 =20 (Age cannot be negative)Putting the value of B in equation (3)A=4B/5A=4(20)/5A=16So Age of A=16 and Age of B=20Regardshttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLQZ3up_KsaKVaSGU_PrN-w
